div.p: Hello/Bonjour,
My name is Donald Roussel.

I’m the Associate Assistant Deputy Minister
Safety and Security here at Transport.

Transport Canada is very pleased to
be launching the I-100 introduction to the

Incident Command
System e-Learning courses.

The Incident Command System or ICS is
an internationally recognized proven system

used for responding to wide range of
incidents regardless of scale and complexity.

One of the hallmark features of this
system is its standardization which allows

personnel from many different organizations
to respond collaboratively under one

common consolidated plan speaking common
languages having a common understanding of

roles and responsibility and using a
common process to address the needs of an incident.

You may often hear that TC
personnel are not first responders

yet we do have the duty to respond in
keeping with our mandate and authorities.
and often need to work interoperably outside a variety of other organizations.

In the spirit of continuous improvement and
embracing best practices, TC is beginning

a comprehensive multiyear
ICS implementation efforts.

This will allow TC to strengthen and align
our response activities with the growing

numbers of partners already using ICS
and will unable most/more effective and

coordinated responses
across all modes.

This represent an exciting evolution in
the way that our department respond to transport

related event and an opportunity to move
toward a common streamline approach to
incident management.

Training will be a critical factor for
the successful implementation of ICS.

The e-Learning course you are about to take
will provide you with an orientation and
introduce you to the basic of the system.

For some of you, this course will be
first step towards further ICS training.

For some others, this will provide you
with the familiarization you need to be ICS aware.

Please enjoy this e-Learning courses
it will help you apply the principals of

ICS and build our collective skills and
knowledge to ensure a safe, secure, clean

and efficient transportation
system for Canadians.

Thank you very much
and enjoy your courses.
